description:
Variation  of time condition under s.73 of the Act pursuant
to additional conditions 1 and 2 of the planning permission
granted in outline by the Secretary of State
(DOE Ref. No. T/APP/x5210/A/93/218957/P7) for the
redevelopment of the site by the erection of a building in
B1 (Business Class Use) together with the provision if a
retail (Class A3 - food and drink) unit at 152/156 North
Gower Street in order to allow further time for the
implementation of that planning permission.
As shown on illustrative drawing Nos. 9123-1A, 2A, 4, 5A, 6,
7, and 8.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - [a]  Prior to commencement of works on site (including
    demolition of the existing building), approval of details of
    the design and external appearance of the building, the
    means of access thereto, and the landscaping of the site
    (hereinafter called 'the reserved matters') shall be
    obtained from the Local Planning Authority.
    [b]     Application for approval of the reserved matters
    shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the
    expiration of three years from the date of this letter.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun either
    before the expiration of 5 years from the date of this
    letter or before the expiration of 2 years from the date of
    approval of the last of the reserved matters to be approved,
    whichever is the later.

Condition : 3 - The building hereby approved shall not exceed 25m in height
    above ground level and all roof plant shall be accommodated
    within the building envelope herein approved.

Condition : 4 - The restaurant use hereby permitted shall not begin until
    full details of the scheme for the ventilation of and the
    extraction of fumes from the premises to an adequate outlet
    level, including details of sound attenuation for any
    necessary plant have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council and the development shall not be carried out
    otherwise than in accordance with any approval given.

Condition : 5 - Before the use commences, details of the method of storage and waste removal (including recycled materials) shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and the approved method shall thereafter be maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6, DS6 (and SH18 if A3 use)] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - Before either of the uses herein approved commence, full
    details of [1] disabled access and [2] cycle parking
    provision are to be submitted to and approved by the Council
    and the development shall be carried in strict accordance
    with those details thus approved.

Condition : 7 - The facing materials to be used including: the roofing
    system, window frames, risers, balconies, soffites, cladding
    system, render and brick shall not be otherwise than as have
    been submitted to and approved before any work on site has
    commenced.

Condition : 8 - The A3 (food and drink) use herein approved shall not be
    carried out outside the envelope of the building.

Condition : 9 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 10 - In order to comply with the provisions of Section 92 of the
    Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 11 - In order that the Council may be satisfied with the external
    appearance of the building and to protect the Strategic
    View from Primrose Hill to St Pauls.

Condition : 12 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 13 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 14 - In order that the building is accessible to disabled persons
    and in  order that adequate provision is made for cycle
    parking.

Condition : 15 - In order that the Council may be satisfied with the external
    appearance of the building.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjioning premises and the
    area generally and to avoid hazard to pedestrians.

Condition : 17 - The Council supports schemes for the recycling of bottles
    and cans and encourages all hotels, restaurants, wine bars
    and public houses to do so as well. Further information can
    be obtained by telephoning the Council's Street Environment
    Service (Recycling) on 0171 485 1553.

Condition : 18 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under the Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Environmental Consumer
    Protection Service (Pollution Team), Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 0171-278 4444), or to seek
    prior approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any
    difficulty  in carrying out construction other than within
    normal working hours and by means that would minimise
    disturbance to adjoining premises.

Condition : 19 - The arrangements for the storage of refuse and solid waste
    may be subject to control under the Building Regulations,
    and you are advised to consult the Council's Streets
    Management, Building Control Service, Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street  WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 0171-413 6100).

Condition : 20 - The Building Regulations may impose requirements for the
    provision of access and sanitary conveniences for people
    with a physical impairment which limits their ability to
    walk, and people who need to use a wheelchair. In this
    respect you are advised to  consult the Council's Streets
    Management, Building Control Services, Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ. (Tel:0171 413 6941)

Condition : 21 - The development hereby approved must be carried out in
    strict compliance with the plans referred to in this
    permission. Any alteration to the approved scheme resulting
    either from the requirements of the Building Control
    Manager, or for any other cause, must not take place except
    with the written agreement of the Council as local planning
    authority.
